article: , As a child, I started learning to play the piano, my favorite musical _ ,but I was forced to give up when I started my middle school _ I could concentrate more on my studies. It's one of my biggest _ to stop practicing the piano when I recall sadly today. During the following years, I kept telling my piano teacher that I would _ . However, I didn't keep my promise because I was _ with my study. _ I lost touch with my teacher. Some years later, my teacher died. I was very sad because I lost such a good teacher. She was a very warm and gentle person. It hurts me to think she may have been _ that I never returned. I haven't taken lessons since then but to be honest, I _ to. Sitting at the piano, I couldn't help recalling many _ times of my practising at home and playing before my teacher and one time my teacher _ me after I played entire pieces of music wrong in front of her colleagues. I was so _ that I could hardly say anything. But her _ helped ease my shame. These memories, _ , good or bad, never caused my _ for playing the piano again. This thought then led me to think that _ is like music, and that we all try to play different _ in the instrument of our life. Sometimes the pitch is _ when we play it well, but sometimes we are out of tone. However, we all continue to create our own _ style of music. No matter what style our music is, it is _ that we sing the songs of joy, quietness and love. Though I may never make it back to piano lessons, it doesn't _ that I've stopped making music.
